Module downfall
Package downfall.util

Class PathRelativisor

  • java.lang.Object
    • downfall.util.PathRelativisor
  • public final class PathRelativisor
extends java.lang.Object
    Relativizes path to an executable path, a given path or a file. If the path provided does not lie inside the user.dir or another file, path provided as an argument it returns the absolute path instead.

      • path

    • Constructor Detail

      • PathRelativisor

        public PathRelativisor()
        Default constructor. does not provide the path to be relativized. If you're using this constructor you should provide the path later with setPath();

      • PathRelativisor

        public PathRelativisor​(java.nio.file.Path path)
        Parameters:
        path - Path to be relativized as a Path.

      • PathRelativisor

        public PathRelativisor​(java.io.File file)
        Parameters:
        file - File, a path to which you want to relativize.

      • PathRelativisor

        public PathRelativisor​(java.lang.String pathname)
        Parameters:
        pathname - Pathname which you want to relativize.

    • Method Detail

      • relativize

        public java.lang.String relativize()
        Relativizes the path to user.dir, which is the directory from which the application was launched.
        Returns:
        Relative path of the path set in the PathRelativisor. If the path is not inside user.dir returns absolute path instead.

      • relativizeTo

        public java.lang.String relativizeTo​(java.io.File file)
        Relativizes the path to the file provided.
        Parameters:
        file - File to which you want to relativize your path.
        Returns:
        Relative path of the path set in the PathRelativisor. If the path is not inside the file it returns absolute path instead.

      • relativizeTo

        public java.lang.String relativizeTo​(java.lang.String pathname)
        Relativizes the path to the pathname provided.
        Parameters:
        pathname - Pathname which you want to relativize your path. This pathname has to be absolute, otherwise it will return what's already stored wether it's absolute or not.
        Returns:
        Relative path of the path set in the PathRelativisor. If the path is not inside the file it returns absolute path instead.

      • relativizeTo

        public java.lang.String relativizeTo​(java.nio.file.Path path)
        Relativizes the path to the pathname provided.
        Parameters:
        path - which you want to relativize your path. This path has to be absolute, otherwise it will return what's already stored wether it's absolute or not.
        Returns:
        Relative path of the path set in the PathRelativisor. If the path is not inside the file it returns absolute path instead.

      • setPath

        public void setPath​(java.nio.file.Path path)
        Lightweight mutator method.
        Parameters:
        path - Path to be relativized as a Path.

      • setPath

        public void setPath​(java.io.File file)
        Lightweight mutator method.
        Parameters:
        file - File, a path to which you want to relativize;

        public void setPath​(java.lang.String pathname)
        Lightweight mutator method.
        Parameters:
        pathname - Pathname which you want to relativize.
